message: fellow geeks, anyone knows a good alarming software for winodws or ubuntu? I need a reminder to take a break every one hour or so. thanks

data.message: I think you can use the task scheduler of windows but i am not sure about that

A popular technique related to that is "Pomodoro Technique". It's pretty popular that it should be easy to find apps / browser plugins for. https://www.google.com/search?q=Pomodoro+reminder+for+windows

In the standard form of this technique you work for 25 minutes then take 5 minutes break. However, customizations like working 50 minutes and taking 10 minutes break are popular as well, and I think  are supported in many apps.

If you consider other options besides native desktop OS apps, like browser extensions and phone apps, the range of stuff you can find using the keywords "Pomodoro app" will increase a lot.
If there is no tools on linux then create your own script and add it to the crontab :D

Mohamed Elsherif
ليه الراجل لما سأل عن حاجة في asp 
اعتبرتوها Searchable
 و مسحتوا البوست بتاعه و حاجة زي كدة موجودة عادي و الناس بترد؟! عمري ما قدرت اشوف اتساق في تطبيق معايير الجروب الصراحة.

Maybe this is not the same as you need but it may help
It is a blog post (For linux users) explains about 10 different applications for healthy usage of the computer. Some of these applications notify you if you spent long time setting to your computer. 
https://itsfoss.com/health-fitness-tool-linux/
if you know how to make a cron job on ubuntu you can make a cron job that runs a scipt that could make a notification or something that could remind you. :D
